thread.title: Carson's campaign manager blasts profane GQ article
thread.title_full: Carson's campaign manager blasts profane GQ article | Fox News

author: FoxNews.com
title: Carson's campaign manager blasts profane GQ article
text:
FoxNews.com livefyre Email Print
Ben Carson’s campaign manager fired back Thursday at a critical GQ article that ran under the headline, “ F--- Ben Carson .”
The GQ column was published shortly after Carson made controversial comments on the recent Oregon mass shooting, saying "I would not just stand there and let him shoot me." The GQ piece lambasted Carson for this and other remarks.
Asked about the article on Fox News' "The Kelly File," Carson campaign manager Barry Bennett said, "It's amazing."
"This guy should be writing about the do's and don'ts of pocket squares. When it comes to political writing, he needs to get out of the building," he said.
And he also defended Carson's original comments.
"He said what I hope I would do is fight back. That’s what we all hope. We never know until we're in that situation. He wasn’t casting judgment on anyone. Just asking what he would do. And then they take that out of context and try to turn it into something else. It’s ridiculous,” he said.
The GQ article described comments from Republican presidential candidates as an "arms race of stupid."
Bennett said, "well everybody is stupid who doesn't agree with him 100 percent."
